intro: Oxypetalum insigne var. glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
